flawed_nl_solution:
The flashlight was 20/100 of the price of the hoodie, so 80 * 20/100 = $<<80*20/100=400/1>>400/1.
The promotion for a pair of boots was 110 * 10/100 = $<<110*10/100=11>>11.
So the pair of boots cost 110 - 11 = $<<110-11=99>>99.
Celina therefore spent 80 + 400/1 + 99 = $<<80+400/1+99=579>>579 on the equipment.
#### 579

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 16, not 400/1. It appears the value was multiplied by the reciprocal of the intended fraction.
